title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 April 2015 - XWiki
content:
<lucaa> has quit  
04:01 <martin-h> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
06:28 <Chuguniy> has quit  
08:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:00 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> has quit  
09:31 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <vmassol1> tmortagne: I'm researching the jdbc drivers for mysql for 7.0 to try to reply to the last mail on the list  
09:51 <vmassol1> I'm a bit worried  
09:52 <vmassol1> has someone tried XWiki 7.0 on mysql already?  
09:52 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:52 <tmortagne> no idea, I'm currently upgrading from 6.4.3 to 7.0 on debian to try  
09:52 <vmassol> ok cool  
09:52 <vmassol> he seems to have problem with 5.0.8 but from http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/connector-j/en/news-5-0-8.html  
09:52 <tmortagne> maybe we need to upgrade hibernate since we did not do it in a chile  
09:52 <vmassol> it seems it's JDBC4 copmpliant  
09:53 <tmortagne> \*while  
09:53 <vmassol> \*compliant  
09:53 <vmassol> even 5.0.0 seems JDBC4 compliant: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/connector-j/en/news-5-0-0.html  
09:53 <vmassol> in any case he says that even 5.1.35 doesn't work for him  
09:54 <vmassol> so there's something strange  
09:54 <tmortagne> not sure if there is much difference between jdbc 4 and jdbc 4.1  
09:55 <tmortagne> and dbcp 2.1 seems to expect jdbc 4.1  
09:55 <vmassol> this is what we need to know  
09:55 <vmassol> whether DBCP 2.1 requires 4.1 or 4.0  
09:56 <vmassol> might be 4.1: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28750102/apache-dbcp-2-1-to-work-with-oracle-v11-2-0-1  
09:56 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> btw this seems to mean that we're going to drop support for oracle 11g: "Oracle 11g does not support JDBC 4.1. http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#000\_00."  
09:57 <vmassol> http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01\_03  
09:57 <vmassol> 11g support JDBC4 but not 4.1  
09:58 <tmortagne> dropping support for oracle 11 sounds a but extreme even if I don't know well what are the most used Oracle versions  
09:58 <vmassol> so it's possible we're gong a bit too far in the requirement  
09:58 <vmassol> \*going  
09:58 <vmassol> we have 2 options: roll back to DBCP 1.4 (requiring 4.0) or DBCP 1.3 (requiring 3)  
09:59 <vmassol> JDBC 4 should be pretty much ready for all DBs so we need to decide  
09:59 <vmassol> it seems 4.1 might be the one that is a bit too recent  
09:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> going to start creating a jira issue with the info and then I'll send a mail on the list  
10:02 <tmortagne> hmm that's weird http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian-tomcat7-pgsql/ does not contain the 7.0-1 debian packages I deployed, it was before the move for sure  
10:02 <tmortagne> looks like I will have to redo it...  
10:02 <vmassol> lost by Fabio?  
10:02 <vmassol> you should ask him  
10:03 <vmassol> he might still have it  
10:03 <tmortagne> good news looks like I have a mysql driver working well with 7.0  
10:03 <tmortagne> waiting for XWiki to be fully initialized and will check the version  
10:04 <vmassol> ah? what version of the driver?  
10:04 <vmassol> ok  
10:05 <tmortagne> mysql-connector-java-5.1.28.jar  
10:05 <vmassol> hmm  
10:05 <vmassol> so we need to check if that implement JDBC 4 or 4.1  
10:06 <tmortagne> it was not working for Ricardo with 5.1.35 but maybe he did a mistake  
10:07 <vmassol> it's really not clear from the DBCP home page is DBCP 2 requires a JDBC 4.1 driver or not  
10:07 <vmassol> it says it requires Java 7 and the JDBC API in 7 is JDBC 4.1  
10:07 <vmassol> but that doesn't mean it's not going to work with 4.0 drivers  
10:07 <vmassol> "DBCP 2 binaries should be used by applications running under Java 7." this is our case  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <vmassol> "DBCP 2 is based on Commons Pool 2 and provides increased performance, JMX support as well as numerous other new features compared to DBCP 1.x" so there's incentive to use version 2 too  
10:10 <cjd> has quit  
10:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> ok so I think we need to do more tests on various DBs before taking a decision  
10:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: ricardo's error is strange: http://atriumkm.idisantiago.es/bin/download/ICT/XWikiUpgradeIssues/tomcatErrorLog.UpgradingTo70.txt  
10:16 <vmassol> it doesn't look related to the driver itself  
10:16 <tmortagne> seems ok for mysql, hsqldb and pgsql so far, we'll need to check Oracle and see what version of Oracle we want to support  
10:17 <vmassol> so far we have said: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DatabaseSupportStrategy  
10:17 <vmassol> Mysql 5.x  
10:17 <vmassol> pgsql 9.x  
10:17 <vmassol> oracle 11.x  
10:17 <vmassol> hsqldb 2.3.1+  
10:18 <vmassol> so we need to try with 11g  
10:18 <vmassol> for pgsql did you try with 9.x?  
10:19 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <tmortagne> I did not tried anything myself but the two people who tried with pgsql would make it work with the right driver  
10:20 <vmassol> we need to check what version of pgsql they used  
10:20 <tmortagne> what made me build a new version of the Debian packages  
10:20 <tmortagne> need to check IRC history  
10:21 <tmortagne> I think it's pgsql 9.2  
10:23 <vmassol> ok that would be cool  
10:23 <vmassol> what version of mysql have you used tmortagne?  
10:24 <tmortagne> 5.5.41 on the server where I did the upgrade  
10:24 <vmassol> ok  
10:24 <vmassol> we would need to check if we still support 5.x < 5.5.x  
10:25 <vmassol> on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL we just say 5.x too  
10:26 <vmassol> I'll try to find my oracle vm to test  
10:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> good news it works fine on oracle 11g with the same driver as before :)  
10:47 <vmassol> so it seems to indicate that DBCP 2.1 doesn't require JDBC 4.1 but only 4.0  
10:47 <vmassol> according to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01\_03  
10:47 <vmassol> (I've used ojdbc6.jar FTR which is for java6)  
10:52 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:03 <cjd> hi Trefex, I wrote some basic documentation on the xwiki xar tool I was talking about...  
11:03 <cjd> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/node-xwikimodel  
11:03 <cjd> xardump Admin:admin@blk1:8080/xwiki/wiki/wiki1/export/Main/WebHome  --> dump to filesystem  
11:03 <cjd> (from running wiki)  
11:04 <cjd> xargen --> roll a .xar file  
11:04 <Trefex> cjd: cool. Could you recall me the workflow? Because I'm new to xar and stuff  
11:04 <cjd> xargen --post Admin:admin@blk1:8080/xwiki/rest/wikis/wiki1  
11:04 <Trefex> ah you're on it :)  
11:04 <cjd> create xar and auto-post  
11:09 <Trefex> cjd: so this would allow to edit the wiki locally  
11:10 <Trefex> obviously, this does not handle concurrent changes  
11:10 <Trefex> i mean, it would keep track of versioning, but not of merges, right?  
11:12 <cjd> no versioning  
11:12 <cjd> it dumps the most recent version  
11:12 <cjd> it's really for building xwiki applications  
11:13 <Trefex> cjd: but you mentioned this in the context of git versioning right?  
11:13 <cjd> I develop my xwiki applications in the filesystem in git  
11:13 <cjd> and then post them to the wiki to test  
11:19 <Slashman> hello, I'm looking for a way to create a user that can create other accounts without being admin, is this possible ?  
11:20 <cjd> check how XWiki.Registration does it, it's just a page  
11:20 <cjd> Register permission -> right to create accounts  
11:24 <Slashman> cjd: I'm looking for it but I cannot find it...  
11:27 <Trefex> cjd: how do i compile the binaries from the git repo?  
11:27 <Trefex> there's only xargen but no xardump in it  
11:31 <cjd> Trefex: sorry, just use `npm install -g xwiki-tools`  
11:32 <cjd> lemme fix the readme  
11:32 <Trefex> ah it's a symlink to describdeoc  
11:32 <Trefex> haha ok  
11:38 <cjd> improved readme https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/node-xwikimodel  
11:54 <Trefex> i changed bin/describedoc and did a npm install after  
11:55 <Trefex> why doesn't it update the installation cjd?  
11:58 <cjd> because it's installed in a different place from where you checked out the git repository  
11:58 <cjd> you can just checkout the git repo and then do  
11:58 <cjd>     npm install  
11:58 <cjd> in the git repo  
11:58 <cjd> then invoke the scripts from within that repo  
11:59 <cjd> If you improve it, please make a PR :)  
11:59 <Trefex> yeah i'm trying  
11:59 <Trefex> but i can't re-install them  
11:59 <Trefex> ah crap  
11:59 <Trefex> i see  
11:59 <Trefex> packages.json refers to the git repo  
12:01 <cjd> if you do    /path/to/your/checkout/of/xwiki-tools/bin/describedoc blah blah  
12:01 <cjd> it should work  
12:01 <Trefex> yeah but how can i deploy my own version in the global path  
12:01 <Trefex> mhhh  
12:01 <cjd> mmm symlink it manually :)  
12:02 <Trefex> i changed the git repo in packages.json and changed the version  
12:02 <Trefex> but it doesn't change :S  
12:04 <cjd> the package.json thing is not useful  
12:04 <cjd> `npm install -g xwiki-tools` downloads a new version from the internet every time  
12:07 <Trefex> ah it takes it from the NPM registry  
12:08 <Trefex> gotcha  
12:08 <Trefex> lunch bbl  
12:08 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki

13:20 <Trefex> cjd: i give up  
13:20 <Trefex> i tried to make it work with HTTPS, but have to change your complete codebase  
13:54 <cjd> oh, indeed  
13:54 <cjd> it's a little bit spread out #evolutioncode  
13:54 <cjd> let me see if I can do it in a few minutes, I have a meeting coming up  
14:06 <cjd> Trefex: I just wrote the ssl patch and pushed it into git, do you think you could pull it and do a test for me? I don't seem to have an xwiki instance with SSL handy  
14:06 <cjd> I did not do an npm publish because I'm not sure if it has a bug  
14:09 <Trefex> kk  
14:10 <cjd>  /path/to/describedoc --ssl blah:blah@host:port/path///  
14:11 <cjd> and /path/to/xargen --ssl --post blah:blah@host:port/path///  
14:11 <cjd> oop there's a bug, it defaults to port 80  
14:12 <cjd> so just pass 443 manually  
14:13 <Trefex> get a timeout  
14:13 <Trefex> testpage ❯ ../node-xwikimodel/bin/describedoc --ssl Admin:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):443/xwiki/wiki/biocoredoc/view/Main/Test                                                                                                                                                                                        02:12:44 ⏎  
14:13 <Trefex> query: Admin:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):443//xwiki/wiki/biocoredoc/view/Main/Test?name=x&pages=Main.Test  
14:13 <Trefex>             ^  
14:13 <Trefex> Error: socket hang up  
14:13 <Trefex>     at createHangUpError (\_http\_client.js:215:15)  
14:13 <Trefex>     at TLSSocket.socketOnEnd (\_http\_client.js:293:23)  
14:13 <Trefex>     at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:129:20)  
14:13 <Trefex>     at \_stream\_readable.js:908:16  
14:13 <Trefex> sorry for spam  
14:14 <cjd> can I access that server ?  
14:16 <cjd> ok try /export/ instead of /view/  
14:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:18 <Trefex> normally you can't  
14:18 <Trefex> if you can access it, tell me :D  
14:18 <cjd> no dns  
14:18 <cjd> :)  
14:18 <Trefex> phew  
14:18 <Trefex> same error with export  
14:20 <cjd> can you curl the url ?  
14:20 <cjd> it looks like something's not working with accessing the server  
14:22 <evalica> has quit  
14:22 <cjd> curl --user Admin:admin 'blk1:8080/riscoss/wiki/wiki1/export/Main/WebHome?name=x&pages=Main.WebHome'  
14:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <cjd> should see binary dumped onto the screen  
14:26 <Trefex> can see a dump ye  
14:28 <cjd> hmm  
14:28 <cjd> in one window:  
14:29 <cjd> sudo tcpdump -A -s0 -n -i <your interface name> 'tcp port 443' 2>&1 | tee tcpdump.log  
14:29 <cjd> in the other window: ../node-xwikimodel/bin/describedoc --ssl Admin:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):443/xwiki/wiki/biocoredoc/export/Main/WebHome  
14:30 <cjd> then ctrl+c tcpdump windoe  
14:30 <cjd> and  cat ./tcpdump.log | curl -F 'sprunge=<-' http://sprunge.us  
14:36 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <mflorea> has quit  
14:37 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <Trefex> http://sprunge.us/GiHe  
14:40 <cjd> ugh forgot ssl <2 minutes of hate>  
14:41 <cjd> you implemented ssl in tomcat/jetty ?  
14:42 <Trefex> euh  
14:42 <Trefex> no  
14:42 <Trefex> i think we do apache -> ajp  
14:42 <cjd> and 8080 is firewalled?  
14:43 <Trefex> no, but we're not listening on that port  
14:43 <Trefex> that's what ajp is for  
14:43 <cjd> usually it binds to 8080 anyway  
14:43 <cjd> b/c I've always used the tool to connect directly to xwiki so using apache in front is a big YMMV  
14:45 <Trefex> ah well  
14:45 <Trefex> curl for the win  
14:45 <Trefex> node for the fail  
14:46 <cjd> :)
